QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 1. The word "Bible" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Writing|B. The books|C. Holy|D. Literature|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 2. The word "Scripture" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Writing|B. All the books|C. Holy|D. Literature|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 3. The two major divisions of the Bible are:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Prophecy and poetry|B. Gospels and epistles|C. Old and new testaments|D. Law and history|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 4. The number of books in the Bible:
5. The number of books in the Old Testament:
6. The number of books in the New Testament:
7. The Old Testament books are divided into the following categories:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Law, history, poetry, prophecy|B. Gospels, history, epistles, prophecy|C. Neither of these.|D. Both of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 8. The New Testament books are divided into the following categories:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Law, history, poetry, prophecy|B. Gospels, history, epistles, prophecy|C. Neither of these.|D. Both of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 9. The word "testament" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The books|B. Covenant|C. Writing|D. A plan|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 10. The purpose of the Bible includes:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Doctrine|B. Correction|C. Instruction|D. All of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 11. The "unity of the Bible" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. It is united in content|B. It is united in theme|C. Both of these|D. Neither of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 12. The "diversity of the Bible" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. It has variety|B. It conflicts itself|C. It is united in content|D. Different men wrote it|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 13. The revelation of both Old and New Testaments is centered on:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Satan|B. Man|C. Sin|D. Jesus Christ|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 14. The Bible is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Not divinely inspired|B. Similar to the Koran|C. The written Word of God|D. Just one of many divine manuscripts|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 15. A translation of the Bible:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Translates word for word|B. Translates letter by letter|C. Translates thought by thought|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 16. A paraphrase of the Bible:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Translates word for word|B. Translates letter by letter|C. Translates thought by thought|D. All of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 17. The word "version" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The same as translation|B. Written in the same language as the original manuscript of the Bible|C. The same as paraphrase|D. Written in a language other than what the Bible was originally written|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 18. The language in which the Bible was originally written is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Hebrew|B. Greek|C. Aramaic|D. All of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 19. Geography tells ___________ an event happened:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. When|B. Where|C. Why|D. How|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 20. History of chronology tells ___________ an event happened:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. When|B. Where|C. Why|D. How|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 21. Biblical archaeology is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The study of the future|B. The study of the past|C. The same as geography|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 22. Which is the oldest date?
23. The difference between a translation and a paraphrase version of the Bible is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. A translation is word for word|B. A paraphrase is word for word|C. A paraphrase is not true to original Scripture|D. A translation is not true to original Scripture|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 24. The word "prerequisite" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Afterwards|B. Before creation|C. Something you must do before you can do something else|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 25. The key prerequisite for understanding the Bible is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Attending a good Bible college|B. Knowing God|C. A good Bible commentary|D. Good study skills|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 26. In order for you to study His Word, God has provided:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Teachers|B. The Holy Spirit|C. Both of these|D. Neither of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 27. The great Teacher sent from God after Jesus returned to Heaven was:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The Holy Spirit|B. Peter|C. Paul|D. John|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 28. The "milk " of the Word of God means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Truths difficult to understand|B. Truths simple to understand|C. Both of these|D. Neither of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 29. The "meat" of the Word of God means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Truths difficult to understand|B. Truths simple to understand|C. Both of these|D. Neither of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 30. In order to move from the milk to the meat of the Word of God you should:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Desire to do it|B. Be obedient|C. Search for the meat|D. All of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 31. To "rightly divide" the Word of truth means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. To discuss it|B. To interpret it properly|C. To read what others say|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 32. The "verbal" inspiration of the Bible means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Every word in the original was not fully inspired|B. Every word in the original was fully inspired|C. Partial inspiration of Scripture|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 33. The "plenary" inspiration of the Bible means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Full inspiration of Scripture|B. Partial inspiration of Scripture|C. Every word in the original manuscript was not inspired|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 34. Those who add to God's Word are warned that:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. All the plagues in the Word will be added to them|B. Their name will be deleted from the book of life|C. Both of these|D. Neither of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 35. Those who take from God's Word are warned that:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. All the plagues in the Word will be added to them|B. Their name will be deleted from the book of life|C. Both of these|D. Neither of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 36. According to the Biblical record, who was the first man to write down God's Words at His direction?
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Job|B. Abraham|C. Moses|D. Adam|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 37. To be a "doer of the Word and not a hearer only" means:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. You should listen to the Word and not be involved in doing it|B. You should do the Word and not just listen to it|C. To listen is better than to do|D. None of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 38. It is important that you always study a verse within its:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Context|B. Setting|C. Chapter|D. All of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 39. A key word is:
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Often repeated|B. Important to the meaning of the verse|C. Important in the chapter|D. All of these|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 40. Read the list below. Which word is a key word and would be a good subject for word study?
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. He|B. Temperance|C. She|D. If|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 41. Match each Bible study tool: Commentary
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Provides comments on the Bible, verse by verse, chapter by chapter.|B. Maps and information on the geographical setting of the Bible.|C. Like a regular dictionary, but defines words as they are used in the Bible rather than modern times.|D. Helps you locate references.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 42. Match each Bible study tool: Bible dictionary
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Provides comments on the Bible, verse by verse, chapter by chapter.|B. Maps and information on the geographical setting of the Bible.|C. Like a regular dictionary, but defines words as they are used in the Bible rather than modern times.|D. Helps you locate references.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 43. Match each Bible study tool: Bible atlas
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Provides comments on the Bible, verse by verse, chapter by chapter.|B. Maps and information on the geographical setting of the Bible.|C. Like a regular dictionary, but defines words as they are used in the Bible rather than modern times.|D. Helps you locate references.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 44. Match each Bible study tool: Concordance
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Provides comments on the Bible, verse by verse, chapter by chapter.|B. Maps and information on the geographical setting of the Bible.|C. Like a regular dictionary, but defines words as they are used in the Bible rather than modern times.|D. Helps you locate references.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 45. Match each Bible study tool: Bible encyclopedia
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Lists topics of the Bible and scriptural references for them.|B. Detailed study of Biblical words.|C. General information on the Bible: background, history, etc.|D. None of the Above|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 46. Match each Bible study tool: Topical Bible
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Lists topics of the Bible and scriptural references for them.|B. Detailed study of Biblical words.|C. General information on the Bible: background, history, etc.|D. None of the Above|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 47. Match each Bible study tool: Word study books
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Lists topics of the Bible and scriptural references for them.|B. Detailed study of Biblical words.|C. General information on the Bible: background, history, etc.|D. None of the Above|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 48. Match each form of Biblical poetry : Synonymous parallelism
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The second and following lines give an illustration or emblems to express the truth of the first line.|B. The second and following lines express an opposite truth which relates to the first line of the poem.|C. The second and following lines express a thought identical to the first line.|D. The second and following lines each build on the truth expressed in the first line.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 49. Match each form of Biblical poetry : Emblematic parallelism
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The second and following lines give an illustration or emblems to express the truth of the first line.|B. The second and following lines express an opposite truth which relates to the first line of the poem.|C. The second and following lines express a thought identical to the first line.|D. The second and following lines each build on the truth expressed in the first line.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 50. Antithetic parallelism: Match each form of Biblical poetry
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The second and following lines give an illustration or emblems to express the truth of the first line.|B. The second and following lines express an opposite truth which relates to the first line of the poem.|C. The second and following lines express a thought identical to the first line.|D. The second and following lines each build on the truth expressed in the first line.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 51. Synthetic parallelism: Match each form of Biblical poetry
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The second and following lines give an illustration or emblems to express the truth of the first line.|B. The second and following lines express an opposite truth which relates to the first line of the poem.|C. The second and following lines express a thought identical to the first line.|D. The second and following lines each build on the truth expressed in the first line.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 52. Match each type of Biblical poetry: Dramatic poetry
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. This type of poetry is sung.|B. This type of poetry is a drama.|C. This type of poetry is narrative or in story form. It often tells of heroic action.|D. None of the Above|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 53. Match each type of Biblical poetry: Epic poetry
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. This type of poetry is sung.|B. This type of poetry is a drama.|C. This type of poetry is narrative or in story form. It often tells of heroic action.|D. None of the Above|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 54. Match each type of Biblical poetry: Lyric poetry
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. This type of poetry is sung.|B. This type of poetry is a drama.|C. This type of poetry is narrative or in story form. It often tells of heroic action.|D. None of the Above|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 55. Match each part of speech : Noun
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. An action word.|B. Tells how something was done.|C. A descriptive word.|D. Name of a person, place, or thing.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 56. Match each part of speech : Adjective
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. An action word.|B. Tells how something was done.|C. A descriptive word.|D. Name of a person, place, or thing.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 57. Match each part of speech : Verb
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. An action word.|B. Tells how something was done.|C. A descriptive word.|D. Name of a person, place, or thing.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 58. Match each part of speech : Adverb
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. An action word.|B. Tells how something was done.|C. A descriptive word.|D. Name of a person, place, or thing.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 59. Match each form of Biblical writing : Discourse form
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Story form|B. Psalms is an example|C. Like a sermon|D. Short stories to illustrate spiritual truth|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 60. Match each form of Biblical writing : Poetic
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Story form|B. Psalms is an example|C. Like a sermon|D. Short stories to illustrate spiritual truth|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 61. Match each form of Biblical writing : Parable
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Story form|B. Psalms is an example|C. Like a sermon|D. Short stories to illustrate spiritual truth|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 62. Match each form of Biblical writing : Narrative
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Story form|B. Psalms is an example|C. Like a sermon|D. Short stories to illustrate spiritual truth|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 63. Match each connective word : Like, As
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Shows a contrast is going to be made.|B. Means something is going to be added to what has been said.|C. Reveals that a comparison is going to be made.|D. Shows what has been said is conditional upon the response of God's people.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 64. Match each connective word : And
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Shows a contrast is going to be made.|B. Means something is going to be added to what has been said.|C. Reveals that a comparison is going to be made.|D. Shows what has been said is conditional upon the response of God's people.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 65. Match each connective word : If
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Shows a contrast is going to be made.|B. Means something is going to be added to what has been said.|C. Reveals that a comparison is going to be made.|D. Shows what has been said is conditional upon the response of God's people.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 66. Match each connective word : But, or, of
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Shows a contrast is going to be made.|B. Means something is going to be added to what has been said.|C. Reveals that a comparison is going to be made.|D. Shows what has been said is conditional upon the response of God's people.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 67. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study: Synthetic study
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The devotional method|B. The topical method|C. Book study|D. Chapter study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 68. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study: Study of God's Word chapter by chapter
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The devotional method|B. The topical method|C. Book study|D. Chapter study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 69. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study: Study of a specific subject.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The devotional method|B. The topical method|C. Book study|D. Chapter study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 70. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study: Stresses dedication, consecration, and worship.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The devotional method|B. The topical method|C. Book study|D. Chapter study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 71. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study:Study of the life of a Biblical personality.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Paragraph study|B. Verse study|C. Bible survey|D. Biographical study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 72. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study:Study of sections of a chapter.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Paragraph study|B. Verse study|C. Bible survey|D. Biographical study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 73. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study:Synthetic Bible study.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Paragraph study|B. Verse study|C. Bible survey|D. Biographical study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 74. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study:This should always be done in the context of a paragraph and chapter.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Paragraph study|B. Verse study|C. Bible survey|D. Biographical study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 75. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study: Study of Bible types.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Synthetic study|B. Theological study|C. Analytical study|D. Typological study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 76. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study: Study of a basic Bible doctrine.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Synthetic study|B. Theological study|C. Analytical study|D. Typological study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 77. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study: To survey something for general content; like a book survey.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Synthetic study|B. Theological study|C. Analytical study|D. Typological study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 78. Read each description and identify the type of Bible study: To study the individual parts in detail.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Synthetic study|B. Theological study|C. Analytical study|D. Typological study|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 79. Match each theological term in List One with the correct definition: Christology
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The study of the doctrine of the Bible.|B. The study of Jesus Christ.|C. The study of the doctrine of the Church.|D. The study of last things.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 80. Match each theological term in List One with the correct definition: Bibliology
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The study of the doctrine of the Bible.|B. The study of Jesus Christ.|C. The study of the doctrine of the Church.|D. The study of last things.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 81. Match each theological term in List One with the correct definition: Eschatology
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The study of the doctrine of the Bible.|B. The study of Jesus Christ.|C. The study of the doctrine of the Church.|D. The study of last things.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 82. Match each theological term in List One with the correct definition: Ecclesiology
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The study of the doctrine of the Bible.|B. The study of Jesus Christ.|C. The study of the doctrine of the Church.|D. The study of last things.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 83. Match each theological term in List One with the definition: Angelology
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The doctrine of salvation.|B. The study of man.|C. The study of good angels.|D. The study of bad angels.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 84. Match each theological term in List One with the definition: Soteriology
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The doctrine of salvation.|B. The study of man.|C. The study of good angels.|D. The study of bad angels.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 85. Match each theological term in List One with the definition: Demonology
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The doctrine of salvation.|B. The study of man.|C. The study of good angels.|D. The study of bad angels.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 86. Match each theological term in List One with the definition: Anthropology
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The doctrine of salvation.|B. The study of man.|C. The study of good angels.|D. The study of bad angels.|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 87. Match each theological term in List One with the definition: Satanology
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The study of the doctrine of Satan.|B. The study of the doctrine of the Holy Spirit.|C. Archeology|D. Primitivity|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 88. Match each theological term in List One with the definition: Pneumatology
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. The study of the doctrine of Satan.|B. The study of the doctrine of the Holy Spirit.|C. Archeology|D. Primitivity|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 89. Look up each reference in your Bible. Identify the form of Biblical poetry which is used in that passage: Look up Psalms 3:l. This verse is written in ______________ parallelism.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Antithetic|B. Emblematic|C. Synonymous|D. Synthetic|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 90. Look up each reference in your Bible. Identify the form of Biblical poetry which is used in that passage: Look up Psalms l:6. This verse is written in ______________ parallelism.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Antithetic|B. Emblematic|C. Synonymous|D. Synthetic|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 91. Look up each reference in your Bible. Identify the form of Biblical poetry which is used in that passage: Look up Psalms l:l-2. This verse is written in _____________ parallelism.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Antithetic|B. Emblematic|C. Synonymous|D. Synthetic|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 92. Look up each reference in your Bible. Identify the form of Biblical poetry which is used in that passage: Look up Psalms 42:l. This verse is written in _____________ parallelism.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. Antithetic|B. Emblematic|C. Synonymous|D. Synthetic|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 93. The Bible is the written Word of the one true God.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 94. Although God inspired the Bible, He used men to write down His words.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 95. Because there were many writers over many years, the Bible contains contradictions.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 96. There is no united theme of the Bible. It is just a collection of books on different subjects.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 97. The major prophets of the Old Testament are more important than the minor prophets.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 98. No translation of the Bible is exact.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 99. I completed reading the text for this course.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|

QUESTIONRECORD.Q: 100. I completed the self-tests at the end of each chapter.
QUESTIONRECORD.A: A. True|B. False|
